pageContext.claim: “If he [Biden] got elected -- and they say this -- if he got elected, that's an overhang over the market, because the market would crash, would absolutely crash.”
pageContext.analysis: Actually, analysts at JP Morgan say a Biden victory could be positive for the stock market, because even if the Democrat managed to repeal or revert some of Trump's tax cuts, infrastructure spending, softened tariff rhetoric, and a higher federal minimum wage could be "net positive for S&P 500 earnings and largely offset the corporate tax headwind," according to the JP Morgan note.
